intro: Sinthroblastes timorensis, commonly known as the Timor sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark-colored wood. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white flowers that are typically followed by woody capsules containing seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry, open woodlands. Due to its rarity and ecological importance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
